DOC.brief_summary: This 4-year cluster randomize control trial aim determine whether implementation Evidence-based Practice Improving Quality ( EPIQ ) method reduce hospital-acquired infection Chinese Neonatal Intensive Care Units ( NICUs ) .
DOC.brief_title: Reduction Infection Neonatal Intensive Care Units Using Evidence-based Practice Improving Quality
DOC.detailed_description: Following randomization two group , intervention NICUs ( n = 12 ) receive train EPIQ method develop , implement , document evidence-based practice change reduce hospital-acquired infection . Compliance practice change neonatal outcomes monitor . NICUs receive quarterly feedback progress , well access implementation support . Control NICUs ( n = 12 ) collect neonatal data continue provide standard care . Study subject preterm infant bear < 34 week ' gestation admit participate NICUs trial ( estimate n = 5,200 per year ) . Data analysis conduct compare neonatal outcome health-care resource use intervention control group .
DOC.criteria: Infants bear < 34 week ' gestation Admitted participate NICUs within 7 day birth Admitted participate NICUs May 1 , 2015 April 30 , 2018 Infants major congenital anomaly Infants moribund admission ( decision make provide palliative care )
